Safety Information
FRONTIET
Airbus A318/A319

Exit Seating Criteria
The Federal Aviation Regulations require that passengers seated in the emergency exit seats
be able to meet the following criteria and perform the following duties:
• Have sufficient mobility, strength, or dexterity in both arms and legs to:
Reach upward, sideways, and downward to the location of emergency exit
operating mechanisms;
• Pesh, shoves, rution timilar in sien thd weet to overwing exits ut the window;
Remove obstructions similar in size and weight to over-wing exits;
Reach the emergency exit expeditiously;
Maintain balance while removing obstructions;
• Be 15 years of age or older and have the capacity to perform the listed duties without
assistance of an adult companion, parent, or other relative.
• Be able to read and understand instructions related to emergency evacuation which are
provided in printed or graphic form and be able to understand oral commands given by
a crewmember in the English language.
• Be able to see well enough to perform the listed duties and assess conditions outside
of the exit without the assistance of visual aids other than contacts or eyeglasses.
• Be able to hear well enough to understand instructions shouted by crewmembers
without assistance other than a hearing aid.
: Be tre trom the responsibility of caring for Someone who cannot be left unattended for
the duration of the flight.
• Be free from any condition that might cause you harm if you were to perform one or
more of the listed duties.
• Be able to occupy the exit seat without use of a seatbelt extension (additional belt
length can be an entanglement hazard for those exiting quickly).
If you are unable, or do not want this responsibility, you may contact a crewmember and
request to be reseated. It is not necessary for you to explain why.
Exit Row Responsibilities
• Follow directions and hand signals of your crew. If a crewmember is not available to
assist you, follow the instructions on this Safety Card and posted signs.
• Locate the emergency exit. ASSESS OUTSIDE CONDITIONS (look for smoke, fire or
obstructions) - IF OPENING THE EXIT INCREASES THE HAZARD TO PASSENGERS, DO NOT
• Recognize the emergency exit opening handle. Before opening the exit, wait until the
airplane has stopped. If it is safe to do so, operate the emergency exit per instructions.
• Assess conditions of the escape slide. Inflate the slide and stabilize after deployment to
assist others in getting off the slide according to the instructions.
• Assess, select, and follow a safe path away from the emergency exit and away from the
airplane.
Your Flight Attendants will be glad to answer any questions you might have.
FOR THE SAFETY OF OTHERS, PLEASE DO NOT REMOVE THIS
CARD FROM THE AIRPLANE.
Please obey the "No Smoking" and "Fasten Seatbelt" signs, all posted signs and placards
and all instructions given by your flight crew.
Final assembly of this airplane was completed in Germany.
Frontier and Frontier Airlines are service marks of Frontier Airlines, Inc.
